name: Qantas Premium Economy on the A380
description:
It’s time to fly!  This time I’m checking out Premium Economy on the world’s largest passenger aircraft – the massive Airbus A380.

I’m flying with Qantas from Melbourne to Singapore on QF35 – the perfect 7 ½ hour flight to check out the full Qantas Premium Economy service and see if it is worth the upgrade from standard economy class.  

This Qantas flight review features the entire Qantas premium economy product from departure through take off, the onboard service, the seat, entertainment system and our landing in Singapore.  

Join me and we’ll experience the Qantas A380 together. 

NOTE:  Qantas has 12 Airbus A380s in their fleet – they are currently upgrading these so that the premium economy and business class seats are the same standard as those featured on the Qantas 787.  At the time of uploading only one aircraft had been done and another one (this one I flew) was being done.  It will take until the end of at least 2020 until all 12 aircraft are upgraded.  

Here are some links referred to in my video:

Qantas 787 Business Class (London to Perth): https://youtu.be/nMllaCgDj8w
China Eastern 787 Business Class:  https://youtu.be/XoWYkzaQK4I


Route:     Melbourne (MEL) to Singapore (SIN)
Length:   3,754 miles, 7:32 hrs
Flight:     QF35   Seat 24A
Aircraft:  Airbus A380-800  registration VH-OQH (Aug 2009) 
When:    14 August 2019

Camera:  Panasonic HC-VX1


This video may not be reproduced without specific permission.
